Nicolai Berk | About

Hi, and welcome to my Website!


My name is Nicolai Berk, I am a PhD Candidate at the Dynamics Research Training Group and the Group for Comparative Politics at Humboldt University Berlin.

My main interest revolves around political communication and its effects on elites’ and voters’ cognitive representations of politics. Among other things, this concerns how news framing affects political attitudes and voting behaviour in the real world. To study these topics, I combine computational text analysis and econometric tools. I also did some work on the measurement of radical-right rhetoric and its adoption by other parties.

Before moving to Berlin, I obtained a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science from the University of Vienna and a Master of Science in Social Science from the University of Amsterdam. In Vienna, I was working as a Research Assistant to Markus Wagner, mainly on the Austrian National Election Study (AUTNES). In Amsterdam, I worked for Gijs Schumacher, mainly collecting data for EUSpeech V2. Gijs also invited me to the Hot Politics Lab.

This website contains some information about my academic work, teaching and publications, my CV, as well as some blog posts explaining my work.
